Team Sports
Ayana's family member s and man y other people were at the bus stop to welcome 
her home. Pride and happiness was visible on everyone's face. As the bus came to a 
Games We PlayUnit–III : Our Needs
9
We all play games to entertain ourselves. The games that are played as 
compe titions are known as sports.
Sports can be played in two ways – individually or as a team. The games in 
which a player plays alone against another player are called individual games 
such as archer y, javelin throw, chess etc. wher eas the games in which a team 
of players play against another team are called team games/ sports such as 
crick et, hock ey, football etc.Let'sKnow Let'sKnow
Environmental Studies-563

halt, Ayana and some other girls got down with a huge shining trophy and 
everyone burst into claps and cheer s. Everyone was hugging them and shaking 
hands with them.
Can you guess, wha t was happening at the bus stand?
Well, the girls kabaddi team of Vista Public School had just returned after winning 
the state level inter school Kabaddi Championship!
A team represen ts an institution, state or country. A team sport cannot be played 
until each player feels parts of the team. A team sport has man y advantages.  It 
help s the players to grow and become more disciplined. Team sports encourage 
leader ship qualities, sportsmanship and cooper ation, so that players learn to face 
health y compe tition. Team sports build social skills and help people mak e new 
friends.
National T eam
A national team is defined as a team which represen ts a nation. The national team 
consis ts of players from all parts of the country. Though, they belong to different 
castes and religions, but when they go out to play for their country, they have only 
one iden tity, and that is their nationality .
When a national team gives an impr essiv e performance in an interna tional event, 
the whole country cheers the team and celebrates its victory. Thus, the 
performances of national teams unite the people of country.
Stars of India
India is a sports loving nation. There are many sports which have gained 
widespr ead popularity in India, e.g. hock ey, boxing, 
shooting, wrestling, cricket, etc. Besides, many 
players also get interna tional fame in their games. 
Some famous sportsper sons of India are — Major 
Dhyanchand, Geeta Phog at, Saina Nehwal, Sushil 
Kumar , Vish wanathan Anand, M.S. Dhoni, Sania 
Mirz a, Mary Kom etc.
National Game of India
Hockey is the National Game of India. Hockey was introduced in India by 
Englishmen when they first arriv ed from England. Soon, Indians became world-

Sports Awards in India
The six main awards that mak e up India's national Sports Awards are—
 1. Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna Award.
 2. Arjuna Award
 3. Dronachar ya Award
 4. Major Dhyan Chand Award
 5. Maulana Abul Kalam Azad Trophy (MAKA Trophy)
 6. Rash triya Khel Protsahan Purusk ar
class hock ey players. The world's greatest 
hock ey player was Major Dhyanchand. He 
represented India in the 3rd Olympic 
Games. It was said that he had magic in his 
hock ey stick. His birthda y, 29th Augus t, is 
celebr ated as Indian National Sports Day. 
He was given many awards including 
Padma-Bhushan.
The national game o f Japan is 'Go ' and o f China is 'Ping -Pong.You  Know Must (Knowledge )
Breaking Gender Stereotype
It was earlier belie ved that girls were not as good at certain sports and games as 
boys. This belie f has now been proved totally incorrect. 
Man y female sports persons have established their names in games-his tory and 
Environmental Studies-565

Paralympics
Paralympic games or Paralympics is the largest interna tional multi-sport event for 
athletes with a disability . It usually takes place after every Olympic Games in the 
same host city. Ther e are two versions of Paralympic Games—Win ter and Summer 
Games. Some winner s of Paralympic Sports Awards are—Sports bring the best out of the individuals. They mus t be played hones tly and with 
a spirit of true sportsmanship irrespectiv e of caste, gender or religion.
! Deepa Malik—  She is the first India woman to win  a medal 
in Paralympics and won a sliver medal at the 2016 Summer 
Paralympics in shot put. She is paralyzed from the waist 
down due to spinal tumor .
! Murlik ant Petkar—  India's first ever medal in Paralympics 
came in 1972 Games, with Murlik ant Petkar winning a gold 
medal in swimming , inspit e of having a spinal cord injur y.broken gender stereotypes in games. Some wonderful names are— Saina Nehwal, 
Sania Mirz a, P.T. Usha, Geeta Phog at , Karnam Malles wari, Anju Bobb y etc.
! Shee tal Devi— The 16 year old para-archer Shee tal Devi is 
the first international para-archery champion without 
upper limb s. Presiden t Droupadi Murmu conferred the 
Arjuna Award to her on Januar y 9, 2024.
Environmental Studies-5 66

Importance of Games and Sports
! Games and sports help us in men tal and physical growth. They keep our body 
and mind activ e
! They bring the spirit of compe tition and sense of discipline among childr en.
! They help children in understanding the importance of goal setting, 
dedic ation and team work.
! The help us in elimina ting our men tal stress.
! They unite people and foster patriotism.
Ÿ Halt  – A short stop.
! Widespr ead – Found over a large area.
! Stereotype – A fixed opinion about any person or thing , which is often not 
true in reality .
! Paralympics – An interna tional multi-sport event for athletes with a disabilityKey termsKey termsKey terms

! Iden tify the pictur es of na tural calamities giv en abo ve and writ e the names 
belo w the pictur es.
! Have you ever felt an earthquak e? Do you know why does it happen?Safety During CalamitiesUnit–IV : M y Neighbourhood
10
Natural Calamities
The calamities that occur due to natural forces are called natural calamities .
Cyclones, floods, earthquak es, drough ts, tsunamis are some forms of natural 
calamities or disas ters.
Cyclones— These are strong winds rotating inwards. 
The wind speed can reach some times higher than 
100 km per hour . These winds uproot trees and 
cause great destruction. A cyclone is especially 
dang erous in coastal areas because it can lead to a 
A sudden event that causes great damag e to life and property is called a 
disas ter or calamity . Calamities are of two types— Natural Calamities and 
Man-made calamities.Let'sKnow Let'sKnow
Environmental Studies-571

sudden rise in the level of the sea causing floods. This causes heavy loss to human 
life, livestock and property .
Floods— Some times when rivers overflo w due to 
excessiv e rains, floods occur . Floods can also occur 
due to breaking of dams or fast melting of glacier s. 
Due to floods, crops are damag ed which may lead to 
famines. After the flood, man y water-borne diseases 
such as choler a, typhoid, malaria, jaundice etc. also 
claim man y lives.
Drough ts— Drough ts are a natural calamity that 
result from failing monsoon. When there is short age 
of water, crops are unable to grow which causes 
famine. Because of scarcity of wate r and food, 
human beings and domes tic animals die in large 
number s and the gener al popula tion suffers from 
hung er and poverty. 
Earthquak es— A sudden, violen t shaking or trembling of the earth's surface is 
called an Earthquak e. It is caused by severe shock 
waves which move under the ground, travel through 
rocks and reach the surface. These waves are called 
seismic waves. The intensity , direction and duration 
of an earthquak e is recorded by an instrumen t called 
seismogr aph. The scale used to measur e its intensity 
is called Rich ter Scale. Some earthquak es are so mild 
The cyclone Remal hit India recently. It occurr ed in Bay of Bengal during 
the 2024 pre-monsoon season.
In 2013, a multida y clou d burst centered on the North Indian state of 
Uttarakhand caused devastating floods and landslides that 
destroyed sever al villages and towns. Thousands of people were 
swep t awa y, and man y bodies were never recover ed. It is regar ded 
as the most worst natur al disast er in India.You  Know Must (Knowledge )
Environmental Studies-5 72

that they are hardly felt but violen t earthquak es destroy buildings and bury people 
under the debris. Dams may burst and cause floods. All this may lead to large scale 
destruction. Earthquak es measuring above 5 on Rich ter Scale can be devastating.
The Nepal earthquak e of 25 April, 2015 was a strong one, measuring 7.8 
magnitudes on the Rich ter Scale.
Tsunamis— A Tsunami is a gian t sea wave which is caused by an earthquak e or 
volcanic eruption on the floor of the sea i.e. 
under water. The waves can reach a heigh t of 100 
feet, and have a terrific speed and crush everything 
in their path.
The Tsunami waves have a devastating effect. 
Houses and buildings are reduced to rubble. It 
claims scores of human lives and live-stock.
The Tsunami of 26 December , 2004 which hit the coasts of Suma tra, Indonesia, 
Sri Lank a and the Indian provinces of Andaman Islands and Tamil Nadu, was a 
devastating one. Nearly 3 lakhs people died or were missing and the total 
damag e caused was calcula ted to be around 20 billion dollar s.
Volcanic Erup tion— It is a fissur e or vent in the 
earth through which lava flows out. Lava may 
contain rocks, steam and gases. It is very hot. The 
eruption of a volcano can cause large scale 
destruction.
Epidemics and P andemics
When natural calamities occur , communic able diseases are sure to follow. This is 
because germs grow in unhygienic conditions that prevail after the calamity . 
Communic able diseases such as choler a, malaria and plague spread very fast. 
Man y people start falling sick, causing a large number of deaths in a very short 
period of time. This sudden spread of disease in a large number of people in a 
specific area is called an Epidemic.
Environmental Studies-573

If the disease spreads to multiple areas or the entire globe, it is known as 
Pandemic. Multiple pandemics have occurr ed throughout history. The COVID-19 
pandemic (2020-2023)w as the mos t recen t pandemic which affected the whole 
world badly .
Prevention— We can control such epidemics by taking preventive measur es. 
Improvement in community sanitation, health services, immunization 
programmes and hygienic practices are some measur es that can control the 
outbr eak of any epidemic.
Human-Made Calamities
There are certain calamities that are caused due to human activities, the 
involvemen t of humans or their neglig ence.
Bhopal Gas Tragedy (December 4, 1984), Jilin Chemic al Explosion (November 13, 
2005), Deep water Horiz on Oil spill (April 20,2010) are some examples of human-
made disas ters/ calamities. Wars and terrorist attacks also come under this 
category.
Help in Times of Calamities
Several government and non-government organization rescue the afffected 
people when calamity strikes and ruins the lives.
Governmen t Organizations–  Several governmen t agencies like Defence forces, 
the National Disas ter Relief Force, police, hospit als, firefighters etc. come forward 
to rescue the affected people. Epidemic s can occur even when ther e is no natur al calamity. They occur 
because of man 's unhygienic practices. The plague epid emic in Surat 
(Gujar at) in 1994 is an example of this.You  Know Must (Knowledge )
Environmental Studies-5 74

Our soldier s in such odd times not only rescue people but also provide food and 
medicines to affected areas.
Non-Government Organizations– Various national and international non-
governmen t organizagions also provide aid and support to the affected people. 
They collect dona tions and other utility items and distribut e them to the people 
who are affected. Some such organizations are–
! Unit ed Nations childr en's Fund (UNICEF)
! The Oxford Commit tee for Famine Relief (OXFAM)
! Indian Red Cross Socie ty.
! Volun teers for India Developmen t. (VIDE)
! Fight and Drough t Fund.
! Child Relief and You (CRY)
! World Health Organization (WHO)
Safety Measures During Calamities
! Pay close attention to the weather alerts.
! Move to some safer places.
! Keep a waterpr oof emer gency bag ready with dry food, water and medicines.
! Keep a torch handy . Stay calm.
! Keep a diary and note down the phone number s of your local doct ors, fire 
brigade, ambulance, hospit als, police stations and other organizations that 
help in emer gencies.
! Call for help as soon as you sense the dang er.Prime Minist er's National Relief Fund in India is the fund raised to 
provid e support to the people affected by natur al and man -made 
disast ers.You  Know Must (Knowledge )
Environmental Studies-575

Key termsKey termsKey termsAs a Child, What Y ou Can Do
Though you are not an adult but still you can act smartly and help in relief work. You 
can inform rescue workers wher ever help may be needed. You can also dona te 
your old clothes and other usable items to the organizations, who are working for 
disas ter victims.
Role of Media in Disaster Management
The media forges a link between the public 
and emer gency organizations and plays a 
very import ant role in spreading informa tion, 
providing solutions and communicating 
emotions to the public. The social-media 
provides up-to-the-minut e news informa tion 
like road closur e upda tes, evacua tion routes, 
designa ted help areas, shelt er locations and 
more. It help s in creating public awareness 
ŸCalamity  – Disas ter.
ŸGlacier s  – large, thick masses of ice formed on land.
ŸFamine  – Severe short age of food over a long period of time.
Ÿ Seismogr aph – Instrumen t used to record earthquak es.
Ÿ Rich ter scale – A scale used to measur e the intensity of earthquak e.
Ÿ Debris  – Remains of anything destroyed.
Ÿ Fissur e/Vent – Long , deep crack or opening.
Ÿ Erup tion  – Out burst.
ŸCyclones, floods, drough ts, earthquak es, tsunamis etc. are natural calamities 
that strike suddenly and cause great damag e to life and property .
ŸWars, fires, terrorist attacks, oil spills etc. are human-made calamities.
Environmental Studies-5 76and in facilit ating rescue and relief efforts. Thus, media plays an ethical role before, 
during and after any disas ter.
